name: NEET-UG (National Eligibility cum Entrance Test)
description: The single national-level undergraduate medical entrance examination for students who wish to pursue medical (MBBS), dental (BDS), and AYUSH (BAMS, BUMS, BHMS, etc.) courses in government and private institutions in India.

eligibility.ageLimit: Candidate must have completed 17 years of age on or before December 31 of the year of admission. There is no upper age limit.
eligibility.educationalQualification: Must have passed or be appearing for Class 12 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, Biology/Biotechnology and English as core subjects. Minimum 50% aggregate marks in PCB for General category, 40% for SC/ST/OBC-NCL.
eligibility.nationality: Indian Nationals, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs), Overseas Citizens of India (OCIs), Persons of Indian Origin (PIOs), and Foreign Nationals are eligible.

stages.name: Stage 1: NEET-UG Written Exam
stages.description: A single paper of 3 hours and 20 minutes duration. It contains 200 multiple-choice questions (180 to be attempted) from Physics, Chemistry, and Biology (Botany & Zoology). Each subject has two sections: Section A (35 questions, all compulsory) and Section B (15 questions, attempt any 10).

stages.name: Stage 2: Counselling
stages.description: Qualified candidates participate in online counselling conducted by the Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) for All India Quota seats and by respective State authorities for State Quota seats for admission to colleges.

examPattern.markingScheme: +4 marks are awarded for each correct answer. -1 mark is deducted for each incorrect answer. 0 marks for unattempted questions. The total marks are 720.

syllabus.name: Physics
topics: Dual Nature of Matter and Radiation

syllabus.name: Chemistry
topics: Organic Chemistry - Basic Principles and Techniques

syllabus.name: Biology (Botany & Zoology)
topics: Structural Organisation in Animals and Plants

latestUpdate.title: NEET UG 2024 Result to be Declared on June 14, 2024

books.title: NCERT Textbooks for Class 11 & 12 (Physics, Chemistry, Biology)
books.author: NCERT

books.title: Objective NCERT at your Fingertips (for all subjects)
books.author: MTG Editorial Board
